definition: keen interest/concentrated attention
to rise/to flourish/to become popular/to start/to encourage/to get up/(often used in the negative) to permit or allow (dialect)/maybe (dialect)
feeling or desire to do sth/interest in sth/excitement
surname Xing
suffix for nouns
head/hair style/the top/end/beginning or end/a stub/remnant/chief/boss/side/aspect/first/leading/classifier for pigs or livestock/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: She is very keen on sport.
sentences.chinese: 她对体育活动兴头很大。

sentences.english: And the friend doesn't want to quit talking.
sentences.chinese: 你的朋友谈得正在兴头上，没有停下来的意思。

sentences.english: His love spasms had been quick.
sentences.chinese: 他的兴头往往来得很快。

sentences.english: I understand that, but it's time to eat dinner now.
sentences.chinese: 或者，“我知道你正在兴头上，还不想去吃饭。

sentences.english: I made sure everybody did things extra quick.
sentences.chinese: 我确信大家伙都在兴头上。

definition: mood/spirits/interest
interest in dallying/in the mood for playing
vigorously/energetically/enthusiastically
to comply in order to please others/to accommodate sb else's taste/to make fun of
smiles of exultation/radiant with delight
to tease/to poke fun at
happy and excited (idiom)/in high spirits/in great delight
tipsy and merry (idiom)
interest in wine/passion for drinking
subject (under discussion)/thread (of an argument)
(dialect) to be full of zeal/high-spirited/exhilarating/to stir sb up
to enjoy oneself to the full/to one's heart's content
the very moment/just then/during (that brief interval)
to become exhilarated (idiom); in high spirits/full of zest
tipsy feeling
to have one's spirits dampened/to feel disappointed
